unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post draft:
normalised: Okay, here's the normalized version of your Quora post draft, following all your specified rules.

unnormalised: **What's the deal with Urban Gym Culture these days? Is everyone suddenly a fitness freak?**
normalised: **What is the deal with Urban Gym Culture these days? Is everyone suddenly a fitness freak?**

unnormalised: So, I've been noticing this a LOT in Bangalore lately. Everywhere you look, there's a new gym popping up – from Indiranagar to Koramangala. It’s like urban gym culture has exploded! Gone are the days of just the local akhara or a basic weightlifting space. Now it's all swanky 5000 sq ft studios with personal trainers, fancy equipment, and protein shakes that cost more than my lunch!
normalised: So, I have been noticing this a lot in Bengaluru lately. Everywhere you look, there is a new gym popping up – from Indiranagar to Koramangala. It is like urban gym culture has exploded! Gone are the days of just the local akhara or a basic weightlifting space. Now it is all swanky five thousand square feet studios with personal trainers, fancy equipment, and protein shakes that cost more than my lunch!

unnormalised: Is it just me, or is everyone suddenly obsessed with fitness? Back in my college days at IIT Madras, staying fit meant playing a round of cricket or maybe a jog around the campus. Now, folks are talking about macros, CrossFit, and "gainz" non-stop. Even Dr. Sharma from next door is hitting the gym 5 days a week!
normalised: Is it just me, or is everyone suddenly obsessed with fitness? Back in my college days at I I T Madras, staying fit meant playing a round of cricket or maybe a jog around the campus. Now, folks are talking about macros, CrossFit, and "gains" non-stop. Even Doctor Sharma from next door is hitting the gym five days a week!

unnormalised: I see youngsters, like my niece Priya, posting gym selfies on Insta after every workout. And don't even get me started on the gym wear! It’s practically a fashion show. Is it genuine commitment to health, or is it just the 'in' thing to do? I'm curious to know what others think. Is this a good trend, or are we getting a bit carried away? Is the pressure to look a certain way fueled by social media, or are people truly more aware of their health? And more importantly, is it sustainable? Costs Rs. 2000 a month for just basic access, plus trainer fees! What's your take on the whole urban gym culture scene? Let's discuss! I walk 2 km everyday is that enough?
normalised: I see youngsters, like my niece Priya, posting gym selfies on Insta after every workout. And do not even get me started on the gym wear! It is practically a fashion show. Is it genuine commitment to health, or is it just the 'in' thing to do? I am curious to know what others think. Is this a good trend, or are we getting a bit carried away? Is the pressure to look a certain way fueled by social media, or are people truly more aware of their health? And more importantly, is it sustainable? Costs rupee two thousand a month for just basic access, plus trainer fees! What is your take on the whole urban gym culture scene? Let us discuss! I walk two kilometer everyday is that enough?
